## Description {#details}

Utility class representing a non-constant Xor-operand.

We classify non-constant Xor-Operands into two categories: C1) The operand is in the form &quot;X &amp; C&quot;, where C is a constant and C != ~0 C2) C2.1) The operand is in the form of &quot;X | C&quot;, where C is a non-zero constant. C2.2) <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/any">Any</a> operand E which doesn&#39;t fall into C1 and C2.1, we view this operand as &quot;E | 0&quot;

Definition at line 102 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/reassociate-cpp">Reassociate.cpp</a>.
